PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: A production described by Subsection (a)(2)

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: or

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: does not include a production for broadcast that is not intended to be broadcast to either the general public or to cable television service subscribers or paying customers.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: The sale of a motion picture, video, or audio master recording by the producer of the master recording is exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: Tangible personal property that is sold to an entity to which 47 C.F.R. Section 73.624

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: applies is exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the property is necessary for the entity to comply with 47 C.F.R. Section 73.682(d).

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: Tangible personal property that is sold to an entity to which 47 C.F.R. Section 73.404

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: applies is exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the property is necessary to provide the broadcast service described by 47 C.F.R. Section 73.403 or 73.404.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
PROPERTY USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF MOTION PICTURE, VIDEO, OR AUDIO RECORDINGS AND BROADCASTS
text: In this section, master recording means the principal media on which images, sound, or a combination of images and sound are first fixed and from which copies are commercially made available for sale, license, distribution, broadcast, or exhibition for consideration.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: In this section, provider means a provider of cable television service, Internet access service, or telecommunications services.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: A provider is entitled to a refund of the tax imposed by this chapter on the sale, lease, or rental or storage, use, or other consumption of tangible personal property if:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: the property is sold, leased, or rented to or stored, used, or consumed by a provider or a subsidiary of a provider; and

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: the property is directly used or consumed by the provider or subsidiary described by Subdivision

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: in or during:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: the distribution of cable television service;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: the provision of Internet access service; or

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: the transmission, conveyance, routing, or reception of telecommunications services.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: Notwithstanding Subsection (b), property directly used or consumed in or during the provision, creation, or production of a data processing service or information service is not eligible for a refund under this section.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: The amount of the refund to which a provider or subsidiary, as described by Subsection (b)(1), is entitled under this section for a calendar year is equal to:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: the amount of the tax paid by the provider or subsidiary during the calendar year on property eligible for a refund under this section, if the total amount of tax paid by all providers and subsidiaries described by Subsection (b)

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: that are eligible for a refund under this section is not more than $50 million for the calendar year; or

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: a pro rata share of $50 million, if the total amount of tax paid by all providers and subsidiaries described by Subsection (b)

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: that are eligible for a refund under this section is more than $50 million for the calendar year.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
PROPERTY USED IN CABLE TELEVISION, INTERNET ACCESS, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES
text: The refund provided by this section does not apply to the taxes imposed under Subtitle C, Title 3.

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: A newspaper sold or distributed by individual copy or by subscription is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: A transaction involving a sale of a newspaper that has been produced, fabricated, or printed to the special order of a customer is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: the customer is responsible for gathering substantially all of the information contained in the newspaper and for formulating the design, layout, and format of the newspaper;  and

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: the customer would be entitled to the exemption provided by Section 151.318

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: if the customer had a printing facility capable of processing and printing the newspaper and printed and processed the newspaper.

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: The sale of a handbill, circular, flyer, advertising supplement, or similar item that is printed to the special order of a customer and tangible personal property that will become an ingredient or component part of such item are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the item is printed for the exclusive purpose of being distributed as a part of a newspaper, is actually distributed as a part of the newspaper, and is delivered to the person who is responsible for the distribution of the newspaper in which the item is distributed and not to the customer.(d),

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: Repealed by Acts 2001, 77th Leg., ch. 1263, Sec. 84(1), eff. October 1, 2001.

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: In this section, newspaper means a publication that is printed on newsprint, the average sales price of which for each copy over a 30-day period does not exceed $3, and that is printed and distributed at a daily, weekly, or other short interval for the dissemination of news of a general character and of a general interest.  Newspaper does not include a magazine, handbill, circular, flyer, sales catalog, or similar printed item unless the printed item is printed for distribution as a part of a newspaper and is actually distributed as a part of a newspaper.  For the purposes of this section, an advertisement is news of a general character and of a general interest.  Notwithstanding any other provision of this subsection, newspaper includes:

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: a publication containing articles and essays of general interest by various writers and advertisements that is produced for the operator of a licensed and certified carrier of persons and distributed by the operator to its customers during their travel on the carrier; and

section_title: NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
NEWSPAPERS AND PROPERTY USED IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATION
text: a publication for the dissemination of news of a general character and of a general interest that is printed on newsprint and distributed to the general public free of charge at a daily, weekly, or other short interval.
Subscriptions to magazines that are sold for a semiannual or longer period and are entered as second class mail are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

Magazine means a publication that is usually paperbacked and sometimes illustrated, that appears at a regular interval, and that contains stories, articles, and essays by various writers and advertisements.  Magazine does not mean the publication of current information which is taxable pursuant to Section 151.0038 of this code as an information service.

A taxable item sold by a qualified student organization and for which the sales price is $5,000 or less, is exempted from the taxes imposed by Subchapter C, except that a taxable item manufactured by or donated to the organization is exempt from the taxes imposed by Subchapter C  regardless of sales price unless sold to the donor, if the student organization:
sells the item at a sale that may last for one day only and the primary purpose of which is to raise funds for the organization;  and
holds not more than one sale described by Subdivision
each month for which an exemption is claimed for an item sold.
In each calendar year, the first $5,000 of a qualified student organization's total receipts from sales of taxable items not otherwise exempt under Subsection
is exempt from the taxes imposed by Subchapter C.
A student organization qualifies for the exemptions under Subsections
and
if the student organization:

is affiliated with an institution of higher education as defined by Section 61.003, Education Code, or a private or independent college or university that is located in this state and that is accredited by a recognized accrediting agency under Section 61.003, Education Code;
has as its primary purpose a purpose other than engaging in business or performing an activity designed to make a profit;  and
files a certification with the comptroller as required by Subsection (d).
A student organization must file with the comptroller a certification issued by the institution, college, or university described in Subsection (c)
showing that the organization is affiliated with the institution, college, or university.
The storage, use, or consumption of a taxable item acquired tax-free under this section is exempted from the use tax imposed by Subchapter D  until the item is resold or subsequently transferred.
The following are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter:
a container sold with its contents if the sales price of the contents is not taxed under this chapter;
a nonreturnable container sold without contents to a person who fills the container and sells the contents and the container together;  and
a returnable container sold with its contents or resold for refilling.
In this section:
Returnable container means a container of a kind customarily returned for reuse by the buyer of the contents.
Nonreturnable container means a container other than a returnable container.
Container means glass, plastic, or metal bottles, cans, barrels, and cylinders, but does not include any item of a type described in Section 151.302(d).
There are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter the receipts from the sale, use, or other consumption in this state of:
long-distance telecommunications services that are not both originated from and billed to a telephone number or billing or service address within Texas;
access to a local exchange telephone company's network by a regulated provider of telecommunications services;  and
broadcasts, other than cable television service, by commercial radio or television stations licensed or regulated by the Federal Communications Commission.
The exemption provided by this section does not apply to mobile telecommunications services.

section_title: EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
text: The following items are exempted from the sales tax imposed by Subchapter C of this chapter:

section_title: EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
text: drill pipe, casing, tubing, and other pipe used for the exploration for or production of oil, gas, sulphur, or other minerals offshore not in this state;  and

section_title: EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
text: tangible personal property exclusively used for the exploration for or production of oil, gas, sulphur, or other minerals offshore not in this state.

section_title: EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
text: Drilling equipment that is used for the exploration for or production of oil, gas, sulphur, or other minerals, that is built for exclusive use outside this state, and that is, on completion, removed forthwith from this state is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
text: The delivery of items exempted by this section to the purchaser or lessee in this state does not disqualify the purchaser or lessee from the exemption if the property is removed from the state by any means, including by the use of the purchaser's or lessee's own facilities.

section_title: EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
EQUIPMENT USED ELSEWHERE FOR MINERAL EXPLORATION OR PRODUCTION
text: The shipment to a place in this state of equipment exempted by this section for further assembly or fabrication does not disqualify the purchaser or lessee from the exemption if on completion of the further assembly or fabrication the equipment is removed forthwith from this state.  This section applies to a sale that may occur when the equipment exempted is further assembled or fabricated if on completion the equipment is removed forthwith from the state.

section_title: BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
text: The sale, use, or other consumption in this state of Internet access service is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter in an amount not to exceed the first $25 of a monthly charge.

section_title: BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
text: The exemption provided by this section applies without regard to:

section_title: BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
text: whether the Internet access service is bundled with another service, including any other taxable service listed in Section 151.0101(a);  or

section_title: BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
text: the billing period used by the service provider.

section_title: BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
BASIC FEE FOR INTERNET ACCESS SERVICE
text: The exemption in this section applies to the total sales price the service provider charges for Internet access to a purchaser, without regard to whether the service provider charges one lump-sum amount or separately bills the purchaser for each user.

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: The sale of an article of clothing or footwear designed to be worn on or about the human body is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: the sales price of the article is less than $100; and

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: the sale takes place during a period beginning at 12:01 a.m. on the Friday before the 15th day preceding the uniform date prescribed by Section 25.0811(a), Education Code, without regard to any exception authorized by that section, before which a school district may not begin instruction for the school year, and ending at 12 midnight on the following Sunday.

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: This section does not apply to:

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: any special clothing or footwear that is primarily designed for athletic activity or protective use and that is not normally worn except when used for the athletic activity or protective use for which it is designed;

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: accessories, including jewelry, handbags, luggage, umbrellas, wallets, watches, and similar items carried on or about the human body, without regard to whether worn on the body in a manner characteristic of clothing; and

section_title: CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
CLOTHING AND FOOTWEAR FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: the rental of clothing or footwear.

Oct. 1, 2003.Amended by: Acts 2007, 80th Leg., R.S., Ch. 931 (H.B. 3314), Sec. 10(a), eff. June 15, 2007.Acts 2007, 80th Leg., R.S., Ch. 1266 (H.B. 3319), Sec. 7, eff. June 15, 2007.Acts 2011, 82nd Leg., 1st C.S., Ch. 4 (S.B. 1), Sec. 33.01, eff. September 28, 2011.Acts 2013, 83rd Leg., R.S., Ch. 525 (S.B. 485), Sec. 1, eff. June 14, 2013.

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: In this section:

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: Backpack means a messenger bag, book bag, or a pack with straps that a person wears on the person's back, including a backpack with wheels if the backpack can also be worn on the back.  The term does not include an item that is commonly considered luggage, a briefcase, an athletic bag, a duffle bag, a gym bag, a computer bag, a purse, or a framed backpack.

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: School supply has the meaning assigned by the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement adopted November 12, 2002, including all amendments made to the agreement on or before December 14, 2006.(a-1)  The sale or storage, use, or other consumption of a school supply or a school backpack is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the school supply or backpack is purchased:

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: for use by a student in a public or private elementary or secondary school;

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: during the period described by Section 151.326(a)(2); and

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: for a sales price of less than $100.

section_title: SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
SCHOOL SUPPLIES AND SCHOOL BACKPACKS BEFORE START OF SCHOOL
text: A retailer is not required to obtain an exemption certificate stating that school supplies or school backpacks are purchased for use by students in a public or private elementary or secondary school unless the school supplies or backpacks are purchased in a quantity that indicates that the school supplies or backpacks are not purchased for use by students in a public or private elementary or secondary school.
Aircraft are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:
sold to a person using the aircraft as a certificated or licensed carrier of persons or property;
sold to a person who:
has a sales tax permit issued under this chapter; and
uses the aircraft for the purpose of providing flight instruction that is:

recognized by the Federal Aviation Administration;(ii)  under the direct or general supervision of a flight instructor certified by the Federal Aviation Administration; and(iii)  designed to lead to a pilot certificate or rating issued by the Federal Aviation Administration or otherwise required by a rule or regulation of the Federal Aviation Administration;
sold to a foreign government;

sold in this state to a person for use and registration in another state or nation before any use in this state other than flight training in the aircraft and the transportation of the aircraft out of this state; or
sold in this state to a person for use exclusively in connection with an agricultural use, as defined by Section 23.51, and used for:
predator control;
wildlife or livestock capture;
wildlife or livestock surveys;
census counts of wildlife or livestock;
animal or plant health inspection services; or
crop dusting, pollination, or seeding.
Repair, remodeling, and maintenance services to aircraft, including an engine or other component part of aircraft, operated by a person described by Subsection (a)(1), (a)(2), or (a)
are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.
In this section, aircraft does not include a rocket or missile, but does include:
a fixed wing, heavier-than-air craft that is driven by propeller or jet and supported by the dynamic reaction of the air against its wings;
a helicopter;  and
an airplane flight simulation training device approved by the Federal Aviation Administration under Appendices A and B, 14 C.F.R. Part 60.

Machinery, tools, supplies, and equipment used or consumed exclusively in the repair, remodeling, or maintenance of aircraft, aircraft engines, or aircraft component parts by or on behalf of a person described by Subsection (a)
or (a)
are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.
Tangible personal property that is permanently affixed or attached as a component part of an aircraft owned or operated by a person described by Subsection (a)
or (a)(2), or that is necessary for the normal operations of the aircraft and is pumped, poured, or otherwise placed in the aircraft, is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.
To qualify for the exemption provided under Subsection (a)(4), the person purchasing the aircraft in this state must sign at the time of purchase an exemption certificate that:
is designated as an exemption certificate for the purchase of an aircraft for out-of-state registration and use;
is on a form designated by the comptroller;
contains all information the comptroller considers reasonable;
is signed by the purchaser at the time of the purchase;  and
provides that purchaser, by signing the certificate, authorizes the comptroller to provide a copy of the certificate to the state or nation of intended use and registration.
A person commits an offense if the person gives an exemption certificate required under Subsection

to a seller for an aircraft that the person knows, at the time of purchase, will be used in a manner other than that expressed in the exemption certificate or the person gives an exemption certificate with fraudulent intent or intent to evade wrongfully the payment of the tax imposed under this chapter.  An offense under this subsection is a misdemeanor punishable by a fine not to exceed $500.

For purposes of the exemption under Subsection (a)(5), an aircraft is considered to be for use exclusively in connection with an agricultural use if 95 percent of the use of the aircraft is for a purpose described by Subsections (a)(5)(A)-(F).   Travel to a location to perform a service described by Subsections (a)(5)(A)-
does not disqualify an aircraft from the exemption under Subsection (a)(5).  A person who claims an exemption under Subsection (a)
must maintain and make available to the comptroller flight records for all uses of the aircraft.
The following items are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter:
materials, equipment, and machinery that enter into and become component parts of a ship or vessel that is of eight or more tons displacement and is:
used exclusively and directly in a commercial enterprise, including commercial fishing;  or
used commercially as a vessel for pleasure fishing by individuals as paying passengers on the vessel;
a ship or vessel of eight or more tons displacement, that is used exclusively and directly in a commercial enterprise and is sold by the vessel's builder;
materials and labor used in repairing, renovating, or converting a ship or vessel that is of eight or more tons displacement and that is used exclusively and directly in a commercial enterprise;
materials and supplies purchased by the owner or operator of a ship or vessel operating exclusively in foreign or interstate coastal commerce if the materials and supplies:
are loaded on the ship or vessel and used in the maintenance and operation of the ship or vessel;  or
enter into and become component parts of the ship or vessel;  and

materials and supplies purchased by a person providing stevedoring services for a ship or vessel operating exclusively in foreign or interstate coastal commerce if the materials and supplies are loaded aboard the ship or vessel and are not removed before the departure of the ship or vessel.
The sale, other than the lease or rental, and the storage, use, or other consumption of a taxable boat or motor is exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter.
In this section, taxable boat or motor has the meaning assigned by Section 160.001.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: The sale of tangible personal property that under the sales contract is shipped to a point outside this state is exempted from the sales tax imposed by Subchapter C  of this chapter if the shipment is made by the seller by means of:

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: the facilities of the seller;

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: delivery by the seller to a carrier for shipment to a consignee at a point outside this state;  or

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: delivery by the seller to a forwarding agent for shipment to a location in another state of the United States or its territories or possessions.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: The temporary storage of tangible personal property acquired outside this state and then moved into this state is exempted from the use tax imposed by Subchapter D  of this chapter if after being moved into this state the property is stored here temporarily and:

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: is used solely outside this state;  or

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: is physically attached to or incorporated into other tangible personal property that is used solely outside this state.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: The storage, use, or other consumption of tangible personal property that is acquired outside this state is exempted from the use tax imposed by Subchapter D of this chapter if the sale, use, or storage of the property would be exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter had it been sold, leased, or rented in this state.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: If, pursuant to Subdivision

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: of Subsection

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: of this section a delivery is made to a carrier for shipment to a location outside the United States, then the seller must maintain the same documents required by Subsection

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: of Section 151.307 of this chapter.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: Services performed for use outside this state are exempt from the tax imposed by Subchapter C of this chapter.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: Services performed for use both within and outside this state are exempt to the extent the services are for use outside this state and made taxable on or after September 1, 1987.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: The exemption provided by Subsections

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: and

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: of this section do not apply to services performed outside this state for use within this state.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: The sale of tangible personal property to a common carrier is exempted from the sales tax imposed by Subchapter C if the tangible personal property:

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: is shipped to a point outside this state using the purchasing carrier's facilities under a bill of lading;  and

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: is actually transported to the out-of-state destination for use by the carrier in the conduct of its business as a common carrier outside this state.

section_title: INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
INTERSTATE SHIPMENTS, COMMON CARRIERS, AND SERVICES ACROSS STATE LINES
text: The storage or use of tangible personal property acquired outside this state for use as a repair or replacement part for and actually affixed in this state to a self-propelled vehicle that is used as a licensed and certificated common carrier of persons or property is exempted from the use tax imposed by Subchapter D.

section_title: ROLLING STOCK;  TRAIN FUEL AND SUPPLIES
ROLLING STOCK;  TRAIN FUEL AND SUPPLIES
ROLLING STOCK;  TRAIN FUEL AND SUPPLIES
text: Rolling stock, locomotives, and fuel and supplies essential to the operation of locomotives and trains are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: ROLLING STOCK;  TRAIN FUEL AND SUPPLIES
ROLLING STOCK;  TRAIN FUEL AND SUPPLIES
text: Electricity, natural gas, and other fuels used or consumed predominately in the repair, maintenance, or restoration of rolling stock are exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: CERTAIN SALES BY SENIOR CITIZEN ORGANIZATIONS
CERTAIN SALES BY SENIOR CITIZEN ORGANIZATIONS
CERTAIN SALES BY SENIOR CITIZEN ORGANIZATIONS
text: There are exempted from the sales tax imposed by Subchapter C of this chapter  the receipts from the sale of tangible personal property that has been manufactured, produced, made, or assembled exclusively by a person 65 years old or older and that is sold at a qualified sale.  A sale under this section qualifies for the exemption only if it is made as a part of a fund-raising drive held or sponsored by a nonprofit organization created for the sole purpose of providing assistance to elderly persons.  All of the net proceeds derived from sales made during the fund-raising drive must go to the organization, to the persons who manufactured, produced, made, or assembled the items sold, or to both.  An organization created for the purpose of providing assistance to the elderly is entitled to conduct not more than four separate tax exempt fund-raising drives during each calendar year, and the aggregate number of days during a calendar year during which one or more tax exempt fund-raising drives may be held by the organization is 20.  Any sale occurring after the end of the fourth separate fund-raising drive in a calendar year or after the 20th day on which a fund-raising drive is held in a calendar year is not exempted by this section.

section_title: CERTAIN SALES BY SENIOR CITIZEN ORGANIZATIONS
CERTAIN SALES BY SENIOR CITIZEN ORGANIZATIONS
text: There are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter the use, storage, or other consumption in this state of tangible personal property by a purchaser at a sale exempted by this section.

In this section, energy-efficient product means a product that has been designated as an Energy Star qualified product under the Energy Star program jointly operated by the United States Environmental Protection Agency and the United States Department of Energy.
This section applies only to the following energy-efficient products:
an air conditioner the sales price of which does not exceed $6,000;
a clothes washer;
a ceiling fan;
a dehumidifier;
a dishwasher;
an incandescent or fluorescent lightbulb;
a programmable thermostat; and
a refrigerator the sales price of which does not exceed $2,000.

The sale of an energy-efficient product to which this section applies is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the sale takes place during a period beginning at 12:01 a.m. on the Saturday preceding the last Monday in May (Memorial Day) and ending at 11:59 p.m. on the last Monday in May.
In this section:
Water-conserving product:
means tangible personal property that:
is used on private residential property and is not used for business or trade; and(ii)  when used or planted in an outdoor residential property, may result in:
water conservation or groundwater retention;
water table recharge; or
a decrease in ambient air temperature that limits water evaporation; and
includes:
a soaker or drip-irrigation hose;(ii)  a moisture control for a sprinkler or irrigation system;(iii)  mulch;(iv)  a rain barrel or an alternative rain and moisture collection system; and

a permeable ground cover surface that allows water to reach underground basins, aquifers, or water collection points.  WaterSense product means a product that has been designated as a WaterSense certified product under the WaterSense program operated by the United States Environmental Protection Agency, or a similar successor program.
The sale of a water-conserving product or WaterSense product is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the sale takes place during the period described by Section 151.333(c).

section_title: COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
text: Components of tangible personal property used in connection with an advanced clean energy project, as defined by Section 382.003, Health and Safety Code, or a clean energy project, as defined by Section 120.001, Natural Resources Code, are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:

section_title: COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
text: the components are installed to capture carbon dioxide from an anthropogenic emission source, transport or inject carbon dioxide from such a source, or prepare carbon dioxide from such a source for transportation or injection; and

section_title: COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
text: the carbon dioxide is sequestered in this state:

section_title: COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
text: as part of an enhanced oil recovery project that qualifies for a tax rate reduction under Section 202.0545, as provided by Subsection

section_title: COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
text: of that section; or

section_title: COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
COMPONENTS OF TANGIBLE PERSONAL PROPERTY USED IN CONNECTION WITH SEQUESTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE
text: in a manner and under conditions that create a reasonable expectation that at least 99 percent of the carbon dioxide will remain sequestered from the atmosphere for at least 1,000 years.
The sale of gold, silver, or numismatic coins or of platinum, gold, or silver bullion is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: A taxable item sold, leased, or rented to, or stored, used, or consumed by, a tribal council or a business owned by a tribal council of the Alabama-Coushatta Indian Tribe, the Tigua Indian Tribe, or the Texas Band of Kickapoo Indians is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: A taxable item sold, leased, or rented by a tribal council or a business owned by a tribal council of the Alabama-Coushatta Indian Tribe, the Tigua Indian Tribe, or the Texas Band of Kickapoo Indians is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the item is:

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: made by a member of the Indian tribe;

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: a cultural artifact of the Indian tribe;  and

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: sold at a location within the boundaries of a reservation or of trust land held by such an Indian tribe.

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: The storage, use, or consumption of a taxable item acquired in a transaction exempted by Subsection

section_title: SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
SALES BY OR TO INDIAN TRIBES
text: of this section is exempted from the use tax imposed by Subchapter D of this chapter  until the item is resold or subsequently transferred.
Subject to Subsections
and (c), labor to repair, remodel, maintain, or restore tangible personal property is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:

the repair, remodeling, maintenance, or restoration is required by statute, ordinance, order, rule, or regulation of any commission, agency, court, or political, governmental, or quasi-governmental entity in order to protect the environment or to conserve energy; and
the charge for the labor is itemized separately from the charge for materials furnished.
The exemption provided by Subsection
does not apply to the charge for materials furnished by the service provider to the purchaser as part of the service.
Sixty-five percent of a lump-sum charge for labor and materials to repair, remodel, maintain, or restore tangible personal property is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:
the repair, remodeling, maintenance, or restoration is required under the circumstances described by Subsection (a)(1); and
the labor and materials are purchased for a health care facility, as defined by Section 108.002, Health and Safety Code, or for an oncology center.
The receipts from the sale, use, or rental of and the storage, use, or consumption in this state of taxable services are exempt from the tax imposed by this chapter, if:

the services are used for the performance of a written contract entered into prior to the date this chapter takes effect if the contract is not subject to change or modification by reason of the tax;  or

the services are used pursuant to an obligation of a bid or bids submitted prior to the date this chapter takes effect if the bid or bids may not be withdrawn, modified, or changed by reason of the tax imposed by this chapter;  and

if notice of a contract or bid on which an exemption is to be claimed is given by the taxpayer to the comptroller within 60 days from the date this chapter takes effect.The exemption provided by this section shall have no effect after September 30, 1987.
Official state coins produced under Section 11.05, State Purchasing and General Services Act (Article 601b, Vernon's Texas Civil Statutes), are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED BY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATIONS
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED BY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATIONS
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED BY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATIONS
text: A taxable item sold, leased, or rented to or stored, used, or consumed by a nonprofit corporation formed under the Development Corporation Act (Subtitle C1, Title 12, Local Government Code), is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the item is for the exclusive use and benefit of the nonprofit corporation.

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED BY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATIONS
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED BY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATIONS
text: The exemption provided by this section does not apply to an item that is a project or a part of a project that is to be leased, sold, or lent by the nonprofit corporation.
, ch. 167, Sec. 5.01(a)(52), eff. Sept. 1, 1987.Amended by: Acts 2007, 80th Leg., R.S., Ch. 885 (H.B. 2278), Sec. 3.71, eff. April 1, 2009.

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: In this section, qualified person and qualified media production location have the meanings assigned by Section 485A.002, Government Code.

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: The sale, lease, or rental of a taxable item to a qualified person is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter for a maximum of two years if the item is used:

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: for the construction, maintenance, expansion, improvement, or renovation of a media production facility at a qualified media production location;

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: to equip a media production facility at a qualified media production location; or

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: for the renovation of a building or facility at a qualified media production location that is to be used exclusively as a media production facility.

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: A qualified person shall submit an annual report to the comptroller regarding the sale, lease, or rental of taxable items for which a tax exemption is granted to the qualified person under this section.  The report must be in the form and manner prescribed by the comptroller.

section_title: ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
ITEMS SOLD TO OR USED TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, EXPAND, IMPROVE, EQUIP, OR RENOVATE MEDIA PRODUCTION FACILITIES AT MEDIA PRODUCTION LOCATIONS; REPORT
text: The comptroller shall share information from reports submitted under Subsection (c), on request, with the Music, Film, Television, and Multimedia Office within the office of the governor.

There are exempted from the tax imposed by this chapter bins used exclusively as containers in transporting fruit or vegetables from the field or place of harvest to a location where the items are processed, packaged, or marketed.

There are exempted from the tax imposed by this chapter poultry cages used exclusively as containers in transporting poultry from a poultry farm to a location where the poultry is processed, packaged, or marketed.
, ch. 167, Sec. 5.01(a)(52), eff. Sept. 1, 1987.  Amended by Acts 1995, 74th Leg., ch. 1000, Sec. 19, eff. Oct. 1, 1995.

section_title: ANIMALS SOLD BY NONPROFIT ANIMAL SHELTERS
text: The sale, including the acceptance of a fee for adoption, of an animal by a nonprofit animal shelter, as that term is defined by Section 823.001, Health and Safety Code, is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: POST EXCHANGES ON STATE MILITARY PROPERTY
POST EXCHANGES ON STATE MILITARY PROPERTY
POST EXCHANGES ON STATE MILITARY PROPERTY
text: A taxable item sold, leased, or rented to, or stored, used, or consumed by, a post exchange under Section 437.110, Government Code, is exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: POST EXCHANGES ON STATE MILITARY PROPERTY
POST EXCHANGES ON STATE MILITARY PROPERTY
text: A taxable item sold, leased, or rented by a post exchange under Section 437.110, Government Code, is exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

There are exempt from the taxes imposed by this chapter service transactions among affiliated entities, at least one of which is a corporation, that report their income to the Internal Revenue Service on a single consolidated return for the tax year in which the transaction occurs.

For purposes of this section, affiliated entity includes an entity that would be classified as a member of an affiliated group under 26 U.S.C. Section 1504 but for the exclusions provided by that section.
An exemption authorized by this section does not apply to a service that would have been taxable under this chapter as it existed on September 1, 1987.
Services that are exempt under this section may not be purchased for resale by the providing company.
Tangible personal property that is transferred as an integral part of a service exempted under this section may not be purchased for resale by the providing company.
There are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter lawn mowing and other yard maintenance:
performed by an individual younger than 18 years of age whose total receipts from taxable services described by Section 151.0048
or
of this code in the most recent four calendar quarters do not exceed $5,000;
performed by an individual 65 years of age or older whose total receipts from taxable services described by Section 151.0048
or
of this code in the most recent four calendar quarters do not exceed $5,000;  or
performed by an individual:
who is self-employed;  and
whose total receipts from taxable services described by Section 151.0048
or
of this code in the most recent four calendar quarters do not exceed $5,000.

There are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter items sold in connection with a joint research and development venture as defined by 15 U.S.C. Section 4301 that are sold by the joint research and development venture to a participating entity, if the items are created, developed, or substantially modified by or for the joint research and development venture, including items developed as a result of research and/or development agreements entered into by the joint research and development venture with third parties.

There are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter items purchased by, and to carry out the purpose of, a joint research and development venture, as defined by 15 U.S.C. Section 4301, notice of whose establishment and participants was first published in the Federal Register on January 17, 1985, or May 19, 1988, if the items have a useful life in excess of six months when placed in service by the joint research and development venture.
Labor to restore real or tangible personal property is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:
the amount of the charge for labor is separately itemized;  and
the restoration is performed on property damaged within a disaster area by the condition that caused the area to be declared a disaster area.
The exemption under this section does not apply to tangible personal property transferred by the service provider to the purchaser as part of the service.
In this section, disaster area means:
an area declared a disaster area by the governor under Chapter 418, Government Code;  or
an area declared a disaster area by the president of the United States under 42 U.S.C. Section 5141.
In this section, restore means:
launder, clean, repair, treat, or apply protective chemicals to an item, to the extent the service is a personal service as defined in Section 151.0045;  and
repair, restore, or remodel, to the extent the service is:
a real property repair or remodeling service as defined in Section 151.0047;  or
defined as a taxable service in Section 151.0101(a)(5).

section_title: LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
text: Labor to restore, repair, or remodel an improvement to real property is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if:

section_title: LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
text: the amount of the charge for labor is separately itemized;  and

section_title: LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
text: the restoration, repair, or remodeling is performed on an improvement to real property listed in the National Register of Historic Places.

section_title: LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
LABOR TO RESTORE, REPAIR, OR REMODEL HISTORIC SITES
text: The exemption provided by this section does not apply to tangible personal property transferred by the service provider to the purchaser as part of the service.
The following are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter:

a service performed by an employee for the employee's employer in the regular course of business, within the scope of the employee's duties, and for which the employee is paid regular wages or salary;
a service performed by an employee of a temporary employment service for a host employer to supplement the host employer's existing work force on a temporary basis, if:
the service is normally performed by the host employer's own employees;

the host employer provides all supplies and equipment necessary to perform the service, other than personal protective equipment provided by the temporary employment service pursuant to a federal law or regulation;

the host employer does not rent, lease, purchase, or otherwise acquire for use the supplies and equipment described by Paragraph (B), other than the personal protective equipment described by that paragraph, from the temporary employment service or an entity that is a member of an affiliated group of which the temporary employment service is also a member; and

the host employer has the sole right to supervise, direct, and control the work performed by the employee of the temporary employment service as necessary to conduct the host employer's business or to comply with any licensing, statutory, or regulatory requirement applicable to the host employer; or

a service performed by covered employees of a professional employer organization, either licensed under Chapter 91, Labor Code, or exempt from the licensing requirements of that chapter, for a client under a written contract that provides for shared employment responsibilities between the professional employer organization and the client for the covered employees, most of whom must have been previously employed by the client.

The comptroller shall prescribe by rule the minimum percentage of covered employees that must have been previously employed by the client, the minimum time period the covered employees must have been employed by the client prior to the commencement of its contract, and such other criteria as the comptroller may deem necessary to properly implement Subsection (a)(3).
In this section:
Affiliated group has the meaning assigned by Section 171.0001.
Host employer means the employer who owns, manages, or controls the property or worksite where an employee of a temporary employment service performs a service.
Temporary employment service has the meaning assigned by Section 93.001, Labor Code.

section_title: INFORMATION SERVICES AND DATA PROCESSING SERVICES
text: There is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter 20 percent of the value of information services and data processing services.

Court reporting services relating to the preparation of a document or other record in a civil or criminal suit by a notary public or a court reporter licensed by the Judicial Branch Certification Commission are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the document is:
prepared for the use of a person participating in a suit or the court in which a suit or administrative proceeding is brought; and
sold to a person participating in the suit.
Court reporting services covered by this section include services in the preparation of a:
deposition or discovery document;
transcript of testimony;  and
statement of facts.
The exemption provided by this section applies to a document or record on audio or video tape or a computer readable format and courtroom presentation of same.

Court reporting services by a video photographer who is not a court reporter and who videotapes or films a deposition, testimony, discovery document, or statement of fact pertaining to a civil or criminal suit are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the services are provided and sold as described by Subsections (a)
and (2).

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: There are exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter services performed by an employee of a property management company if:

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: the employee is permanently assigned to one rental property by the property management company;

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: the property management company is reimbursed on a dollar-for-dollar basis for the services provided;  and

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: the employee remains assigned to that property while employed by successive owners or management companies.

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: This exemption does not apply to services performed by an employee for properties other than the one to which the employee is permanently assigned.

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: For purposes of this section, a person is an employee of a property management company if either the property management company or an affiliate of the property management company employs the person.

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: The property management company must:

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: be contractually obligated to the property owner to exercise control over the activities of the employee providing the service;  and

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: manage and direct the employee's day-to-day activities.

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: The property management company or the affiliate must pay tax on the taxable items purchased and provided to employees providing services on managed property.

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: In this section, property management company means a person:

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: who, for consideration, operates and manages all the activities at a property held by the owner for purposes of rental, including an office building, mall, or other retail or office complex, an apartment complex, a duplex, or a home;  and

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: whose responsibilities include securing tenants, hiring, and supervising employees for operation or upkeep of the property, receiving and applying revenues, and incurring and paying expenses derived from the operation of the property as directed by the owner.

section_title: SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
SERVICES BY EMPLOYEES OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT COMPANIES
text: In this section, a corporation, limited liability company, partnership, trust, or estate is an affiliate of the property management company if an 80 percent ownership interest in the property management company or the corporation, limited liability company, partnership, trust, or estate is held by the other, or if a third person has an 80 percent ownership interest either directly or indirectly in both the property management company and the corporation, limited liability company, partnership, trust, or estate.
The following are exempted from taxes imposed by this chapter:
rainwater harvesting equipment or supplies, water recycling and reuse equipment or supplies, or other equipment, services, or supplies used solely to reduce or eliminate water use;
equipment, services, or supplies used solely for desalination of surface water or groundwater;
equipment, services, or supplies used solely for brush control designed to enhance the availability of water;
equipment, services, or supplies used solely for precipitation enhancement;
equipment, services, or supplies used solely to construct or operate a water or wastewater system certified by the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality as a regional system;

equipment, services, or supplies used solely to construct or operate a water supply or wastewater system by a private entity as a public-private partnership as certified by the political subdivision that is a party to the project; and
tangible personal property specifically used to process, reuse, or recycle wastewater that will be used in fracturing work performed at an oil or gas well.
In this section, offshore spill response containment property means tangible personal property:
described by Section 11.271(c);
owned or leased by an entity described by Section 11.271(f); and
used or intended to be used solely in an offshore spill response containment system as defined by Section 11.271(a).

This section does not apply to an item used, wholly or partly, for the exploration for or production of oil, gas, sulfur, or other minerals, including the equipment, piping, casing, and other components of an oil or gas well.  For purposes of this subsection, the offshore capture of fugitive oil, gas, sulfur, or other minerals that is entirely incidental to the item's temporary use as an offshore spill response containment system is not considered to be production of those substances.
The sale, lease, rental, storage, use, or other consumption by an entity described by Section 11.271
of offshore spill response containment property used solely for the purposes described by Section 11.271
and this section is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.
A service performed exclusively on offshore spill response containment property is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter.

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: The sale of an emergency preparation item is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the sale takes place during a period beginning at 12:01 a.m. on the Saturday before the last Monday in April and ending at 12 midnight on the last Monday in April.

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: For purposes of this section, emergency preparation item means:

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a portable generator used to provide light or communications or to preserve perishable food in the event of a power outage, the sales price of which is less than $3,000;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: an item listed in this subdivision, the sales price of which is less than $300:

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a storm protection device manufactured, rated, and marketed specifically to prevent damage to a glazed or non-glazed opening during a storm; or

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: an emergency or rescue ladder; or

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: an item listed in this subdivision, the sales price of which is less than $75:

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a reusable or artificial ice product;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a portable, self-powered light source;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a gasoline or diesel fuel container;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a AAA cell, AA cell, C cell, D cell, 6 volt, or 9 volt battery, or a package containing more than one battery, other than an automobile or boat battery;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a nonelectric cooler or ice chest for food storage;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a tarpaulin or other flexible waterproof sheeting;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a ground anchor system or tie-down kit;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a mobile telephone battery or battery charger;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a portable self-powered radio, including a two-way radio or weatherband radio;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a fire extinguisher, smoke detector, or carbon monoxide detector;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a hatchet or axe;

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a self-contained first aid kit; or

section_title: EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
EMERGENCY PREPARATION SUPPLIES FOR LIMITED PERIOD
text: a nonelectric can opener.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: In this section:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: County average weekly wage means the average weekly wage in a county for all jobs during the most recent four quarterly periods for which data is available, as computed by the Texas Workforce Commission, at the time a data center creates a job used to qualify under this section.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Data center means at least 100,000 square feet of space in a single building or portion of a single building, which space:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: is located in this state;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: is specifically constructed or refurbished and actually used primarily to house servers and related equipment and support staff for the processing, storage, and distribution of data;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: is used by a single qualifying occupant for the processing, storage, and distribution of data;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: is not used primarily by a telecommunications provider to place tangible personal property that is used to deliver telecommunications services; and

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: has an uninterruptible power source, generator backup power, a sophisticated fire suppression and prevention system, and enhanced physical security that includes restricted access, video surveillance, and electronic systems.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Permanent job means an employment position that will exist for at least five years after the date the job is created.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Qualifying data center means a data center that meets the qualifications prescribed by Subsection (d).

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Qualifying job means a full-time, permanent job that pays at least 120 percent of the county average weekly wage in the county in which the job is based.  The term includes a new employment position staffed by a third-party employer if a written contract exists between the third-party employer and a qualifying owner, qualifying operator, or qualifying occupant that provides that the employment position is permanently assigned to an associated qualifying data center.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Qualifying operator means a person who controls access to a qualifying data center, regardless of whether that person owns each item of tangible personal property located at the qualifying data center.  A qualifying operator may also be the qualifying owner.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Qualifying owner means a person who owns the building in which a qualifying data center is located.  A qualifying owner may also be the qualifying operator.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Qualifying occupant means a person who:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: contracts with a qualifying owner or qualifying operator to place, or cause to be placed, and to use tangible personal property at the qualifying data center; or

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: in the case of a qualifying occupant who is also the qualifying owner and the qualifying operator, places or causes to be placed, and uses tangible personal property at the qualifying data center.

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: Except as otherwise provided by this section, tangible personal property that is necessary and essential to the operation of a qualified data center is exempted from the taxes imposed by this chapter if the tangible personal property is purchased for installation at, incorporation into, or in the case of Subdivision (1), use in a qualifying data center by a qualifying owner, qualifying operator, or qualifying occupant, and the tangible personal property is:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: electricity;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: an electrical system;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: a cooling system;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: an emergency generator;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: hardware or a distributed mainframe computer or server;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: a data storage device;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: network connectivity equipment;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: a rack, cabinet, and raised floor system;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: a peripheral component or system;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: software;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: a mechanical, electrical, or plumbing system that is necessary to operate any tangible personal property described by Subdivisions (2)-(10);

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: any other item of equipment or system necessary to operate any tangible personal property described by Subdivisions (2)-(11), including a fixture; and

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: a component part of any tangible personal property described by Subdivisions (2)-(10).

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: The exemption provided by this section does not apply to:

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: office equipment or supplies;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: maintenance or janitorial supplies or equipment;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: equipment or supplies used primarily in sales activities or transportation activities;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: tangible personal property on which the purchaser has received or has a pending application for a refund under Section 151.429;

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
text: tangible personal property not otherwise exempted under Subsection

section_title: PROPERTY USED IN CERTAIN DATA CENTERS; TEMPORARY EXEMPTION
